casebody.data:
Ernest Mathews O’NEAL, Appellant, v. UNITED STATES of America, Appellee. No. 25107. United States Court of Appeals Fifth Circuit. Aug. 12, 1968. Ernest M. O’Neal, pro se. Richard C. Chadwick, Asst. U. S. Atty., Savannah, Ga., Donald H. Fraser, U. S. Atty., for appellee.

*636Before JOHN R. BROWN, Chief Judge, WISDOM, Circuit Judge, and BREWSTER, District Judge.

PER CURIAM:

The appeal is dismissed as moot, because the appellant has been administratively accorded credit for his jail time, as authorized by this Court’s decision in Putt v. United States, 5 Cir., 1968, 392 F.2d 64.

Dismissed.
